awd_titl_txt: CI-P: Collaborative:  A Community-Driven Open Research Infrastructure for Intel SGX
awd_abstract_narration:
Historically,when designing the security of a system, operating systems have been considered a part of the trusted computing base (TCB).
However, with the recent shift to cloud computing, there is a pressing need to exclude the OS from the TCB. The Intel Software Guard Extensions (SGX) is a promising new technology that has a great potential to solve this problem. However, its infrastructure, tools, and development ecosystems are developed in a closed manner.

This project is to initiate a community effort in developing an open research infrastructure and support for Intel SGX. In particular, the work will initiate a long-term plan to develop, enhance, and maintain an open source project, OpenSGX, focusing on developing a system emulator, SGX-enabled applications, libraries, kernel drivers, etc., to support its ecosystem. Being an open source research infrastructure, all of the code and documentation will be publicly shared and maintained.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
This funded project aims to develop the use cases of the SGX platform, and so far has generated 5 peer-reviewed publications, and 3 research prototypes (the corresponding source code has been released in the github.com). More specifically, the publication includes: 

[1] "A Case for Protecting Computer Games With SGX". Erick Bauman, and Zhiqiang Lin. In Proceedings of the 1st Workshop on System Software for Trusted Execution, Trento, Italy. December 2016

[2]  "SGX-Log: Securing System Logs With SGX". Vishal Karande, Erick Buaman, Zhiqiang Lin, and Latifur Khan. In Proceedings of the 12th ACM Asia Conference on Computer and Communications Security, Abu Dhabi. April 2017. [Source code at https://github.com/utds3lab/sgx-log]

[3] "Securing Data Analytics on SGX With Randomization". Swarup Chandra, Vishal Karande, Zhiqiang Lin, Latifur Khan, Murat Kantarcioglu, and Bhavani Thuraisingham. To appear In Proceedings of the 22nd European Symposium on Research in Computer Security, Oslo, Norway. September, 2017

[4] "Thwarting Controlled Side Channel Attacks via Enclave Verifiable Page Faults". Yangchun Fu, Erick Bauman, Raul Quinonez, and Zhiqiang Lin. To appear In Proceedings of the 20th International Symposium on Research in Attacks, Intrusions and Defenses, Atlanta, Georgia. September 2017 [Source code at https://github.com/utds3lab/sgx-lapd]

[5] "A Practical Encrypted Data Analytic Framework With Trusted Processors". Fahad Shaon, Murat Kantarcioglu, Zhiqiang Lin, and Latifur Khan. To appear In Proceedings of the 24th ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security, Dallas, Texas. November 2017. [Source code to be released]
